name: New Park Manor

reviews.text: It was obvious from the moment we entered the grounds, this was going to be a special weekend. The beautiful period building was perfectly complemented with a comtempory design that offered luxurious grandeur with a modern and stylish finish. We were first greeted at reception by Daisy, the hotel dog! It was clear from this that Steve and Lee (managers) are devoted animal lovers and welcome any guests, even those with four legs! Our party of 19 were all dealt with efficiently, friendly and professionally and the staff couldn't do enough for us. The food and service is of a quality found only in top restaurants...or so I thought!
reviews.title: Birthday Chillin'

reviews.text: The beautiful grounds contained so many stunning aspects to keep the adults mesmerized but with more than enough nooks and crannies to feed the childrens imaginations. A decadent cream tea service on the lawns was a great touch and set us up nicely for the evening ahead. Just when we thought we couldn't relax any more it was time to hit the spa!
reviews.title: I didn't want to leave!

reviews.text: With a setting sun and wild Stags grazing in the foreground, accompanied with a chilled bottle of Presecco is pretty amazing. Experiencing all this from the hot tub is positvely sublime! Not only this we were given just the right amount of attention from the staff. Allowing us to enjoy the moment whilst still be attentive to our needs.
reviews.title: Luxury weekend

reviews.text: In summary, a beautiful hotel, fantastic food matched only by the quality and friendliness of the staff.
reviews.title: The Best family Hotel ever!
Birthday treat
reviews.text: Perfect - I can't fault it. I was part of a large group that were celebrating a Birthday and taking part in a local triathlon. Steve, Lee, Natalie, Will and all the other staff were consistent with their 100% customer service. Which was more than appreciated considering my nerves over the triathlon. Nothing was too much trouble and all the staff on shift wished me luck (I can't even remember telling them I was taking part!)

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: I've been meaning to write this review for a while, and now I've got round to it. We took a two day break here last month and I've got nothing but praise for the place. The best thing going for it is Steve and the team- without exception the staff were friendly, smiley and nothing was too much trouble.

reviews.title: Beautiful location in the New Forest
reviews.text: The spa was great, recently re-furbished rooms with a variety of styles and sizes to suit different needs, kids welcomed with open arms, great place for walking and cycling- the walking trail maps were particularly welcomed.

reviews.title: chillaxing
reviews.text: If I had one minor area for 'room for improvement' I'd say the restaurant food is solid rather than good, and the lunch/bar menu is a tad over-priced- I know you're paying for all-day service in what is a small hotel so having a chef on is not particularly economic, but still a bit steep in my opinion.

reviews.title: A Perfect Spa Break
reviews.text: But I'm splitting hairs here- this is everything a small hotel should be but so often isn't. I thought it was good value for money, a lovely relaxed feel to the place in beautiful surroundings, and the staff were probably the best I've ever come across in a hotel. Fab and we'll be going back.

reviews.title: Couple and child friendly? Surely not....
reviews.text: We spent three nights here, in a lovely and comfortable room, with views out to wild ponies and deer grazing nearby - how idyllic is that?! DInner was great, although the menu didn't change during our short break, leaving us with limited choices. Breakfast was also good, with a lovely buffet and cooked breakfast if you preferred. There is a spa attached, but we didn't try that. Service was good, with very friendly manager and staff, especially Will and Dan. Afternoon tea on the terrace in the sunshine was very pleasant; the sandwiches were excellent, though the scones were not as fresh as they might have been. Bar service in the lounge was good. All in all, a most relaxing and enjoyable break. We will definitely go back for another visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took my fiancée here on a midweek spa break. A friendly hotel, with an contemporary feel, not over the top, aimed at a young/young at heart clientele. The whole place had a very laid back feel to it. Our room was small, as was the bathroom, but newly refurbished and quiet. Dinner and breakfast were both excellent, as was the spa. Particularly appreciated that we could place a dinner order at 6, take ourselves off to the pool/outdoor jacuzzi, and return to dine later in the evening - the staff didn't seem particularly phased by this request, indeed any request, which made the place feel v welcoming. Those running the dining room on the evening we stayed, and the following morning also, knew what they were up to and had everything under control. There also wasn't any attempt to try to boot you out upon departure - we checked out at 11, each had a massage, used the other spa facilities and left at our leisure.
reviews.title: Mid week one night break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note this is very much a child friendly hotel - indeed it is largely targeted at families. We weren't there with children of our own, there were a few 'in residence', but the children's facilities are well planned. I imagine it may be a different matter during half-terms, holidays and weekends, so bear this in mind if not travelling with kids in tow. Indeed, just call and ask if there are lots of kids booked in as the front desk staff will be able to check.
reviews.title: Great value at a friendly, little known, New Forest, Spa Hotel

reviews.text: The only let downs: An underwhelming reception area that felt a tad on the casual side. A lack of a proper cocktail menu. Some ambitious pricing for certain items (sandwiches, coffees, the few cocktails on offer, though strangely wine was good value). The TV in the room was on a table below the bed level - not a great amount of thought there. The room/corridors still smelled of paint in the part of the hotel we were staying in - an airing wouldn't go amiss. Also pretty laid back service at times, meaning you may wait for an offer of drinks, may be left to your own devices on getting luggage out of cars, that sort of thing - none of which bothered us because we don't like fawning service.
reviews.title: Stylish, sooooo relaxing even with 2 kids under 6!

reviews.text: We would go back if we wanted 24 hours to switch off and relax within 90 minutes drive of our home, the use great facilities, a small hotel feel, and to be looked after by friendly and on the whole competent staff. Also all those deer in the park in front of the hotel - a real treat watching them.
reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant!

reviews.text: We went to the New Park Manor for out wedding anniversary on the recommendation of a work colleague and we loved it. From the outset we were extremely well looked after in every regard. Our room was fantastic with a huge, very comfortable, 4-poster bed, plenty of space and a good en-suite. Dinner was extremely good too; great serving staff, very good, well-presented food and a strong wine list. And breakfast didn't disappoint either. We used the small, but very well equipped spa and were completely relaxed by the end. All in all, a great little place that I would recommend strongly to anyone.
reviews.title: Family Friendly Fantastic!
Child friendly and luxurious - a rare combination
reviews.text: We stayed with our toddler (2 yrs) in one of the newly refurbished family suites and I have to say that it was excellent. The room was really tastefully decorated, however it could do with a blackout blind in the small window opposite where the travel cot was placed as there was only a net curtain. Easily remedied I am sure... The other parts of the hotel had a really chic and modern feel to them and everything was a perfect mix of period country house and modern design.

reviews.title: Lovely place, can't do enough for you!
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to have nice weather for our stay and were able to enjoy the gardens and the grounds, as well as taking bikes out from the hotel into the forest (basically across the road!). The pool area was also very nice and our little boy enjoyed it a lot. The kids club was not very busy and so I think our son did not really take to it for this reason - he likes lots going on around him and it was a bit quiet perhaps when we stayed. No criticism of the staff or the environment though.

reviews.title: Lovely location, nice room, poor service and food.
reviews.text: We were on half board but also ate lunch there most days. Levels of service in the restaurant were generally good, except one evening when it was very busy and they seemed to be a bit under pressure. However nothing to warrant any major issue. The dinner menu had enough choice on it for a long weekend eating there every day and there were specials on offer as well. The staff recognized we were staying for a few nights and very helpfully offered to let us choose from the lunch menu at dinner time if we wanted something different which was a very nice touch. Food was generally very good - fresh, tasty and well presented.

reviews.title: Great family hotel
reviews.text: The staff were all very friendly and helpful, right from the initial booking process and courtesy call a week before our arrival to see if there is anything we needed, through to check in and throughout our stay. Someone was always on hand to warm a bottle of milk for our son at bedtime and nothing was too much trouble! We only decided to hire bikes the day before and again the staff arranged this for us even on a busy bank holiday when they were in short supply.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel
reviews.text: Can't recommend this place enough to families. Lovely place, lovely staff... Great facilities - even a baby bottle cleaning service and complimentary crèche. Visited without my kids this time and wasn't bothered by children at all - very well managed. Will definitely be coming back with my children! Thanks for a lovely stay!

description: Welcome to New Park Manor, a luxury family spa hotel in the New Forest. Relax in our spa, play croquet on the lawn, enjoy afternoon tea on the terrace or some family time in our gardens. New Park Manor offers the perfect destination for anyone wishing to explore and appreciate the unique mosaic of woodland, heathland and wetland that comprise the ancient landscape of the New Forest. The New Forest, Britain's most popular national park, was created by William the Conqueror in 1079 as a royal hunting area. In 1611, King Charles II chose New Park Manor as his favourite hunting lodge and his royal coat of arms is still displayed prominently above the fireplace in our award-winning Stag Restaurant. New Park Manor was carefully adapted for use as a country house hotel with 21 bedrooms and opened in 1970. Interesting details such as acorns and oak leaf patterned doors and original furniture and fireplaces can still be seen throughout the building. These commemorate the debt owed by King Charles to the oak tree which hid him from Cromwell's men on his escape to France in 1651. Today, New Park Manor is a beautiful, stylish country hotel, where the traditions of days gone by still live on and many original features can still be seen around the hotel. Bedrooms range from the splendor of our Barbara Villiers Family Suite to the contemporary style of our Forest rooms. Over recent years, our facilities have expanded to include a heated outdoor pool, croquet lawn, and our award-winning Bath House Spa which included a heated indoor pool and outdoor Canadian hot tub overlooking the New Forest.
